correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

body.ab:
KRAMER-MOSHERStephanie Beth Kramer and Christopher Alan Mosherwere married Oct. 21 in Oneonta Country Club, NewYork
. Th
eir parents are Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Belokur,Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Kramer, all of Sidner. andMrs. James R. Rapp of Chadds Ford, Pa Barry R.Mosher of Newark.The bride, a graduate of Sidney Central High Schooland Syracuse University, Is assistant manager withLord and Taylor. A graduate of Mount Pleasant HighSchool and Syracuse University, the groom Is a computer. programmer with Survey Sampling Inc. The couple will live In Bridgeport, Conn.

CONTINUING- TIIK SIDNEY RECORD, THE BAINBRIDGE NEWS,
rilE UNADILLA TIMES, THE AETON ENTERPRISE, AND HARPURSVILLE BUDGET
SrDNEY, NEW YORK, WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 4,1989 SECTION aT)
Stephanie Kramer,
Christopher Mosher
To Wed in October
SIDNEY — The parents of
Stephanie Beth Kramer of Sidney
and Christopher Alan Mosher of
Bridgeport, CT are pleased to
announce the engagement of their
children.
Stephanie is the daughter of Mr.
and Mrs. Alex Belokur and Mr.
and Mrs. Gerald Kramer, all of
Sidney. Christopher is the son of
Mr. and Mrs. James Rapp of
Wilmington, Delaware and Barry
Mosher of Newark, Delaware.
A graduate of the Sidney
Central School, Stephanie will
earn a degree in Retailing and
Merchandising from Syracuse
University in 1989.
Chris is a graduate of Mt.
Pleasant High School in
Wilmington, Delaware and a 1987
graduate of Syracuse University in
Computer Science. He is
employed by Survey Sampling
Inc. of Fairfield, CT.
An October 1989 wedding is
planned.
